metadata.title: CVE-2021-47345 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/cma: Fix rdma_resolve_route() memory leak Fix a memory leak when"mda_resolve_route() is called more than once on the same "rdma_cm_id".This is possible if cma_query_handler() triggers theRDMA_CM_EVENT_ROUTE_ERROR flow which puts the state machine back and allowsrdma_resolve_route() to be called again.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-84-generic - 5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-84-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-84-lowlatency - 5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-84-generic - 5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-84-lowlatency - 5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1099-kvm - 4.15.0-1099.101
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1111-aws - 4.15.0-1111.118
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1056-aws - 5.4.0-1056.59~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1058-azure - 5.4.0-1058.60~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-gcp - 4.15.0-1108.122
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1052-gcp - 5.4.0-1052.56~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.101').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118').
